Entries.default:
A young woman with a bright, wide smile and eyes to match raises her hand and gives you a quick but enthusiastic wave.

Then, with an exaggerated look of embarrassment, she stops herself and crosses her forearms over her chest.
"Farewell."
"Of course! Now, where did I put that ledger..."
Her face scrunches up in disappointment.
"I always forget that part. Say, you're the Watcher of Caed Nua, aren't you? I've never met anyone famous before!"
"Except the hazanui. She yells at me sometimes." Her grin widens impossibly.
"Good to see you again!" She starts to wave, then remembers herself and crosses her forearms over her chest.
"The hazanui yells at you?"

"'Where's my whiteleaf?!' 'Stop daydreaming!' 'Sabormi, if you lose the ledgers again, I'll have you clean the latrines!'"

At this last comment, she leans close, her eyes wide and voice low with awe.
"All this time, I didn't realize she knew my name."

"Oh, all the time!"

She screws her face up into a look of mock seriousness.

Still, she can't keep from smiling.
"Are you always this excitable?"
She blushes. "It's just... this is my first time away from the rough country."
"I'd heard there were thick, green forests and sandy beaches without a storm in sight, but I'd never imagined this." She shakes her head in wonderment.
"You must've traveled lots. Seen all sorts of amazing places." Sabormi folds her hands under her chin, watching you intently.
"And had adventures you wouldn't believe! See the world, Sabormi. Travel is grand."
"Sure! I've just got to get Eothas to stop stepping on them."
[Shrug] "One place is the same as the next when you get down to it."

"I love Rauatai, but it's hard to go a week without seeing storms. Or hearing about mudslides burying a village somewhere."

Her buoyant expression sags, but only for a moment.
"I sure hope to!"
"You must've been gone a long time, trencher."
"You must not've seen the rough country."
She frowns quizzically.
"Why does this interest you so much?"
"Now, that sounds like an adventure." She sighs dreamily.
"You're the quartermaster - can you sell me something?"
"I really wish I could, but my supplies are for the Royal Deadfire Company and our allies. Hazanui's orders."
"Maybe if you impress her or Atsura, they could make an exception." She smiles hopefully.
